    • mata: 
void foo(real scalar bar)
{
	pointer(real matrix) rowvector ap
	ap = J(1, bar, NULL)
	for(i=1; i<=bar; i++) {
		ap[i] = &(uniform(3,3))
	}
 	for(i=1; i<=bar; i++) {
		i
		*ap[i]
	}
}
end
    All properties

    20 [+] mata block (21 lines) 
    • mata:
void pointer2(real scalar bar1, real scalar bar2)
{
	pointer(pointer(real matrix) rowvector) rowvector pp
	pp = J(1,bar2,NULL)

	for(j=1; j<=bar2; j++) {
		pp[j] = &(J(1, bar1, NULL))
		for(i=1; i<=bar1; i++) {
			(*pp[j])[i] = &(J(i,j,i*j+j^2))
		}
	} 

	for(k=1; k<=bar2; k++) {
		for(l=1; l<=bar1; l++) {
			printf("\n j=%3.0f, i=%3.0f\n", k, l)
			*(*pp[k])[l]
		}
	}
}
end

mata: 
void foo(real scalar bar)
{
	pointer(real matrix) rowvector ap
	ap = J(1, bar, NULL)
	for(i=1; i<=bar; i++) {
		ap[i] = &(uniform(3,3))
	}
 	for(i=1; i<=bar; i++) {
		i
		*ap[i]
	}
}
end

mata:
void pointer2(real scalar bar1, real scalar bar2)
{
	pointer(pointer(real matrix) rowvector) rowvector pp
	pp = J(1,bar2,NULL)

	for(j=1; j<=bar2; j++) {
		pp[j] = &(J(1, bar1, NULL))
		for(i=1; i<=bar1; i++) {
			(*pp[j])[i] = &(J(i,j,i*j+j^2))
		}
	} 

	for(k=1; k<=bar2; k++) {
		for(l=1; l<=bar1; l++) {
			printf("\n j=%3.0f, i=%3.0f\n", k, l)
			*(*pp[k])[l]
		}
	}
}
end
